pages.text: Sometimes, grinding an item up in a $(l:tfc:mechanics/quern)Quern$() will cause liquid to be released. This liquid can be collected in a barrel (or $(l:tfc:artisanal/drums)Drum$()) placed underneath the quern. $(br2)Note that the barrel must be open in order to accept fluid. If the barrel is closed, the result fluid will be wasted.

pages.name: Juicing Apparatus
pages.text: A juicing apparatus. Liquid from items that are ground by the quern will collect in the barrel below.
One thing that can be juiced is Sugarcane. This results in Sugarcane Juice, which is used in $(l:tfc:artisanal/sugar_production)Sugar Production$().

Apples, lemons, and oranges can also be juiced. The resulting juices can be drunk for fruit nutrition. Note that lemon juice is an $(thing)acid$(), so it requires a $(l:tfc:artisanal/drums)drum$() to be placed under the quern, rather than a barrel.
Apple juice can be further fermented to make Cider.
Orange juice can be mixed with vodka to make $(thing)Screwdriver$().
Lemon juice is an $(thing)acid$(), so it can only be collected in a $(l:tfc:artisanal/drums)drum$(), not a barrel.$(br2)It can be used to pickle double metal sheets.
